did.abstract: Collection consists of fragmentary family correspondence Darius, Harriet, and Daniel Gandy. Collection includes an account sheet showing the expenses of Harriet Gandy at the Salem Female Academy, Salem, N.C., 1862; a printed circular (1863) enumerating regulations for the handling and distribution of Confederate Army supplies in Georgia; and a letter (1865) concerning details of executing the law to impress slaves for labor on Confederate fortifications.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Darius Gandy (Darlington, S.C.) was a planter and slaveholder; his daughter, Harriet, attended the Salem Female Academy in Salem, N.C.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of fragmentary family correspondence Darius, Harriet, and Daniel Gandy. Collection includes an account sheet showing the expenses of Harriet Gandy at the Salem Female Academy, Salem, N.C., 1862; a printed circular (1863) enumerating regulations for the handling and distribution of Confederate Army supplies in Georgia; and a letter (1865) concerning details of executing the law to impress slaves for labor on Confederate fortifications.
